function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Financial subsidies may lead to an increase in the production and distribution of IoT devices, potentially increasing the risk of disease transmission through contaminated devices.","Impact":"Increased risk of disease transmission through the proliferation of IoT devices.","Mitigation":"Strict monitoring of IoT device production and distribution, as well as the implementation of sanitary guidelines for handling and using the devices.","Technologies":"IoT tracking and monitoring systems for supply chain and distribution networks.","People":"Manufacturers, distributors, and users of IoT devices.","Owner":"Government, regulatory agencies, and IoT industry stakeholders."},{"Description":"Introduction of new technologies such as 6G, IoT, and immersive XR may lead to an expansion of cashless economies, potentially influencing the spread of contagious diseases through the handling of cashless payments.","Impact":"Increased risk of disease transmission through the widespread adoption of cashless economies.","Mitigation":"Implementation of contactless payment systems, regular disinfection of payment terminals, and public education on hygienic payment practices.","Technologies":"Contactless payment systems, disinfection technologies for payment terminals.","People":"Businesses, consumers, and financial service providers.","Owner":"Government, financial regulatory authorities, and businesses."},{"Description":"The increased reliance on online schooling and work-at-home programs may result in prolonged close contact among individuals, leading to a higher risk of disease transmission in these settings.","Impact":"Increased risk of disease transmission in online schooling and work-at-home environments.","Mitigation":"Implementation of ventilation systems, physical distancing protocols, and regular sanitation in online schooling and work-at-home setups.","Technologies":"Smart ventilation systems, remote monitoring technology for physical distancing, sanitation technologies.","People":"Students, educators, employees, and employers.","Owner":"Educational institutions, employers, and government authorities."}]}
